thread.title: Super Bowl LI is America's biggest blowout since the Bowling Green Massacre
thread.title_full: Super Bowl LI is America's biggest blowout since the Bowling Green Massacre

author: Sam Laird
title: Super Bowl LI is America's biggest blowout since the Bowling Green Massacre
text:
Sometimes on Twitter , people like to make topical jokes in which they knowingly connect two current events from the popular culture to construct a bit of mirth.
The third quarter of Super Bowl LI â€” during which the Atlanta Falcons went up 28-3 on the New England Patriots â€” was one of these times.
Trigger warning: Do not continue reading this post if you're still scarred by "memories" of the Bowling Green Massacre.
SEE ALSO: Simone Biles and Shaq standing side by side at Super Bowl is like a dang optical illusion
First, remember when Donald Trump advisor Kellyanne Conway invented out of thin air a supposed terrorist attack called the " Bowling Green Massacre " during an interview last week?
Yes, you remember. Good.
Because the B.G.M. became big news again on Sunday night as Atlanta started running away with Super Bowl LI. More to the point, everyone thought of the exact same joke at the exact same time, which is always a good time.
This #Superbowl is starting to look like the Bowling Green massacre. #NeverRemember
â€” Martin Plant (@MartinPlant85) February 6, 2017
This is the Bowling Green Massacre all over again. #SB51
â€” Rich Hoffmann (@bmoreabsurd) February 6, 2017
This game is like the Bowling Green Massacre all over again. Sad! #SuperBowl
â€” Suzanne Finnamore (@sfinnamore) February 6, 2017
I haven't seen a bloodbath like this since the Bowling Green Massacre. #SuperBowl #NeverForget
â€” Todd Bergman (@ToddBergman) February 6, 2017
Is this game in bowling green? Cause it's a massacre!
â€” Joe Port ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ (@JoePort) February 6, 2017
This is the biggest massacre since Bowling Green. #SuperBowl
â€” (((Ian L.))) (@i_am_scifi) February 6, 2017
haven't seen a rout like this since the Bowling Green Massacre
â€” Antony Johnston (@AntonyJohnston) February 6, 2017
This game is going to be worse than the Bowling Green Massacre
â€” TheDargerFamily (@TheDargerFamily) February 6, 2017
This is looking similar to the Bowling Green Massacre #SuperBowl
â€” Mike Seville (@M_Seville) February 6, 2017
This super bowl is like the Bowling Green Massacre all over again.
â€” Ron Mexico (@ThoughtMarker) February 6, 2017
Let's get this trending... #SuperBowlingGreenMassacre
â€” Dan Pasternack (@DanPasternack) February 6, 2017
We could embed more tweets, but you probably get the gist by now.
Meanwhile, congrats to everyone who made this joke Super Bowl Sunday. Seems you were more prepared than the Patriots coaching staff.
